DataElement.preferredName: Patient Heart Function Echocardiogram Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of whether a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study based on the patient being assessed for cardiac function by ECHO or a nuclear study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Heart Function Echocardiogram Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an assessment of cardiac function by echocardiogram or nuclear study as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Heart Function Echocardiogram Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).:The normal action performed by a structure or device.:An image of the heart produced by ultrasonography.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).
The normal action performed by a structure or device.
An image of the heart produced by ultrasonography.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Updated to include concept codes & change workflow status to "Released", JG 07/11/2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have an ECHO or a nuclear study (MUGA or First Pass) within 4 weeks prior to treatment assignment and must not have a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < institutional lower limit of normal (LLN). If the LLN is not defined at a site, the LVEF must be > 50% for the patient to be eligible. The following groups of patients are eligible provided they have New York Heart Association Class II cardiac function on baseline ECHO/nuclear study: * Patients with a history of Class II heart failure who are asymptomatic on treatment * Patients with prior anthracycline exposure * Patients who have received central thoracic radiation that included the heart in the radiotherapy port

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients with known left ventricular dysfunction must have ECHO or a nuclear study (MUGA or First Pass) within 8 weeks prior to treatment assignment and must not have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < institutional lower limit of normal (LLN). If the LLN is not defined at a site, the LVEF must be > 50% for the patient to be eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients must have an ECHO or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have an ECHO or a nuclear study (MUGA or First Pass) within 4 weeks prior to treatment assignment and must not have a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < the institutional lower limit of normal (LLN). If the LLN is not defined at a site, the LVEF must be > 50% for the patient to be eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have ECHO or nuclear study (MUGA or First Pass) within 4 weeks prior to treatment assignment and must not have a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 50% to be eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < lower limit of normal (LLN) per institutional guidelines or <55% if threshold for normal is not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines?
